entry.value:
import json import java.io from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback from datetime import datetime
now = datetime.now() minutes = now.minutes last_obs_row = minutes+60
class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) # write down header outputStream.write(text[0] + "\n") # write down weather observations from now to next 60 minutes if (minutes != 0): for line in text[minutes:last_obs_row]: outputStream.write(line + "\n") else: for line in text[minutes+1:last_obs_row]: outputStream.write(line + "\n")
flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback()) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", 'hour_observations.csv') session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)

import json import java.io from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback from datetime import datetime import csv
now = datetime.now() minutes = now.minutes last_forecast_row = minutes+60*24*7
class PyStreamCallback(StreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.readLines(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) outputStream.write(text[0] + "\n") for line in text[minutes:last_forecast_row-1]: outputStream.write(line + "\n") outputStream.write(text[last_forecast_row])
flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile,PyStreamCallback()) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", 'forecast_7days_Hamburg.csv') session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS)
The request failed: Google returned a response with code 400.\n
